author: Special Correspondent
text:
The last session of the Puducherry Legislative Assembly will be convened on Thursday in what would be a brief session with Chief Minister N. Rangasamy who is expected to present ‘Vote-on-Account (Interim Budget) to meet regular expenditure for the next two months.

‘Restrain from announcements’

Meanwhile, the Puducherry Congress has sent a representation seeking the Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) to restrain the ruling party from making any announcement to the people of Puducherry.

In a communication sent to the CEC, the Puducherry Pradesh Congress committee vice-president and former minister V. Pethaperumal brought to the notice of CEC that the Assembly has been convened even after announcement of the poll dates.

Mr. Pethaperumal said, “If the Chief Minister makes any announcement or declaration, it will be against the rules and procedure laid down by the Election Commission.”

Opposition parties are likely to mount scathing attacks on the ruling party if the Assembly lasts for more than a day. The assembly session may be very brief on Thursday.

Previous session

The previous session of the Assembly too was a brief one and concluded within a few minutes of meeting. There was no discussion.
title: Assembly session for vote-on-account today
